pickup_location_id.description:
The unique identifier for the pickup location. (Also known as branch ID)
For Packeta this is a numeric string, but for other carriers it may have a different format.

provider.description: Identifies the provider of the pickup location.

carrier.description:
Specifies the carrier responsible for delivering the order to the pickup location.
In some instances, the carrier may be different from the provider.

services.description:
Describes the delivery services associated with the pickup location delivery (e.g., "inpost_locker_standard" for deliveries to InPost pickup locations). For Packeta this is going to be always an empty string.
Services is a reserved field that Packeta did not implement it yet:
https://docs.packetery.com/03-creating-packets/06-packetery-api-reference.html#toc-services
For PPL it would be a CSV like "COD, PPCK".

dhl_post_number.description:
This field contains the DHL post number (Postnummer) for deliveries to DHL Packstations.
This field is nullable and will only contain data for DHL deliveries.

info.title: Kaufland.de Seller API v2
info.description: This is the Kaufland.de Seller API v2. You can find more information on [https://sellerapi.kaufland.com/](https://sellerapi.kaufland.com/)

post.description:
You can read about Kaufland Shipment Solutions (KSS) soon.

This endpoint provides a temporary link to a PDF file that contains the shipping label.

Please consider shipping restrictions that apply.

`ids_order_units` is a list of order unit IDs that are to be shipped in the same package.

`carriers` is a list of carriers you are able to use to ship the package. If you want to use a specific carrier, you can pass only the desired carrier.
The carrier must be one of the following: `GLS`

`package_measurements` are the properties of the package. The `weight` is in grams, the `width`, `height`, and `length` are in centimeters.

If the response is successful, the response will contain the following properties:
- `id` is the ID of the shipment label.
- `tracking_number` is the tracking number of the shipment.
- `carrier` is the carrier used to ship the package.
- `download_url` is the URL to download the shipping label, the download url works for 7 days.

If you are using the playground environment, the response will always return a dummy success response.
post.summary: Request and create a shipping label.

requestBody.description: Request body containing information about the specification of the shipment.

schema.description: Request body containing information about the specification of the shipment.

get.description:
This endpoint provides a mapping between vat_indicators and actually used vat rates per storefront. The response yields which vat_indicators is accepted on a given storefront.
The vat_indicators can (optionally) be used when creating/updating offers.
get.summary: Get a list of Vat Indicators Mappings per Storefront

item.title: Trixie Kratzbaum Palamos 109 cm anthrazit, 43787
item.description: Kratzbaum "Palamos" Kratzbäume  • Für Katzen jeden Alters geeignet • Mit Plüsch-Bezug • Stämme mit Natursisal umwickelt • Schützen Möbel und Teppiche vor den natürlichen Kratzgewohnheiten der Katzen  • H: 109 cm • 1 Bodenplatte, 39 x 39 cm • 5 Stämme, Ø: 9 cm, 1x 10 cm, 2x 32 cm , 2x 39 cm • 1 Höhle mit Plüscheinlage, 35 x 35 x 24 cm • 3 Liegeplatten, 1x 39 x 39 cm, 2x 29 x 29 cm • Mit Spielzeug am Gummiband • Anthrazit Kratzbäume- Für Katzen jeden Alters geeignet - Mit Plüsch-Bezug - Stämme mit Natursisal umwickelt - Schützen Möbel und Teppiche vor den natürlichen Kratzgewohnheiten der Katzen- H: 109 cm - 1 Bodenplatte, 39 x 39 cm - 5 Stämme, Ø: 9 cm, 1 x 10 cm, 2 x 32 cm , 2 x 39 cm - 1 Höhle mit Plüscheinlage, 35 x 35 x 24 cm - 3 Liegeplatten, 1 x 39 x 39 cm, 2 x 29 x 29 cm - Mit Spielzeug am Gummiband - Anthrazit

description: Lorem ipsum odor amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Pharetra consectetur sem ultrices rhoncus torquent lacus. Taciti dolor turpis lacus proin sociosqu luctus. Sed etiam fringilla rutrum amet dictumst. Pellentesque nostra leo lacus vehicula mus luctus platea nunc. Orci tincidunt aenean elit fames tristique condimentum nec nisl ridiculus? Penatibus lorem volutpat orci justo venenatis turpis. Aliquet himenaeos integer porta fames et sem. Condimentum a vulputate at dui erat! Egestas vivamus convallis semper efficitur facilisis.

put.description:
Add new product data for an EAN or replace your existing one.
The API expects to receive each attribute key only once. If you send the same attribute key multiple times,
only the last value will be used.
For attributes that can have multiple values (for example: picture), you can send an array of values.
put.summary: Add new product data for an EAN or replace your existing one

parameters.description: The language code of the product data (ISO 3166-2)
parameters.name: locale

get.description: Returns the full meta-data for a single report, specified by ID. You can download the report itself by requesting the file in the "url" property of the response, as long as the report is in the done state. To get a list of the IDs of your reports, use the /reports/seller/ endpoint. * @summary Get meta-data for a single report by its ID.
get.summary: Get meta-data for a single report by ID

post.description: Queues the generation of a CSV file that lists all of your items that are currently for sale on Kaufland Global Marketplace. You can use the generated file as the basis for an offers import file by downloading it and editing the fields, then reuploading it.

parameters.description: Parameter to select the affected storefront
parameters.name: storefront

parameters.description: Parameter to select the preferred version
parameters.name: version

post.description:
Queues the generation of a CSV file that lists all of your items that are currently for sale on the kaufland.de site. The new report file includes the current item prices on the marketplace. You can use the generated file as the basis for an inventory import file by downloading it and editing the fields, then reuploading it. The generated file includes the following fields for each item in your inventory:
  • title_item: The title (i.e. name) of the item
  • ean: The EAN of the item
  • condition: The condition of the item (e.g. new or used - very good)
  • price: The price at which you have listed the item in Eurocents (e.g. 4999)
  • shop_price: The item price which is being shown on the marketplace in Eurocents (e.g. 4999)
  • note: If you added a note to the offer (i.e. unit), it is listed here
  • offer_id: The ID of this offer (i.e. unit)
  • location: (Deprecated) The location of the item (e.g. DE for Germany)
  • warehouse: The name of the warehouse where the item is
  • shipping_group: The name of the shipping group which the item is part of
  • count: How many of the item you have in your inventory
  • delivery_time: The delivery time class of the item (e.g. a if it ships within 24 hours)
  • minimum_price: The minimum price you are willing to sell the item for in Eurocents
  • price_cs: The price at which you have listed the item in Euros (e.g. 49,99)
  • shipping_cost_DE: The shipping cost within Germany listed in Euros (e.g. 4,95)

parameters.description: Parameter to select the affected storefront
parameters.name: storefront

post.description: Queues the generation of a CSV file that lists all of your bookings on or after the given date_from timestamp and on or before the given date_to timestamp.

parameters.description: Parameter to select the affected storefront
parameters.name: storefront

parameters.description: Parameter to select the preferred version
parameters.name: version

post.description:
Queues the generation of a CSV file that lists all EANs of the seller, for that no or not enough product data was provided. The generated file includes the following fields for each EAN:
  • ean: EAN of the offer or product
  • reason: Error reason
post.summary: Queue an EANs not found report

parameters.description: Parameter to select the affected storefront
parameters.name: storefront

post.description:
Queues the generation of a CSV file that lists the important changes on products, for that the seller has provided offers. The generated file includes the following fields for each product data change:
  • ean: EAN of the product
  • title: The title of the product
  • changed_attributes: Title and ID of an attribute, which value was changed
  • date_changed: The date of a value change
  • id_item: Kaufland's Product ID
post.summary: Queue a product data changes report

parameters.description: Parameter to select the affected storefront
parameters.name: storefront

post.description:
Queues the generation of a CSV file that lists all orders in the cancelled state. The generated file includes the following fields for each cancelled order:
  • Datum der Stornierung: The date of the cancellation
  • Datum der Order: The date of the order
  • Grund der Stornierung: The reason for cancelling
  • EAN des Artikels: The EAN of the item
  • Hersteller des Artikels: The manufacturer of the item
  • Titel des Artikels: The title (i.e. name) of the item

parameters.description: Parameter to select the affected storefront
parameters.name: storefront

parameters.description: Filter to select what cancellations are Considered (defaults to no filter applied)
parameters.name: cancellation_type

post.description:
Queues the generation of a CSV file that contains a list of all of your listed items along with the cheapest price of each item on the kaufland.de site. The generated file includes the following fields for each item:
  • EAN: The EAN of the item
  • Offer_id: The ID of your offer (i.e. unit)
  • Titel: The title (i.e. name) of the item
  • Günstigster Preis neu: The price of the cheapest new product listing for the item on kaufland.de in Eurocents
  • Günstigster Preis gebraucht: The price of the cheapest used product listing for the item on kaufland.de in Eurocents
  • Ihr Preis: Your price
  • Differenz zu neu absolut: The difference between your price and the cheapest new product price in Eurocents
  • Differenz zu neu %: The difference between your price and the cheapest new product price as a percentage
  • Differenz zu gebraucht absolut:The difference between your price and the cheapest used product price in Eurocents
  • Differenz zu gebraucht %: The difference between your price and the cheapest used product price as a percentage

parameters.description: Parameter to select the affected storefront
parameters.name: storefront

post.description: Queues the generation of a CSV file that contains a list of all of your sales on or after the given date_from timestamp and on or before the given date_to timestamp.

parameters.description: Parameter to select the affected storefront
parameters.name: storefront

post.description:
Queues the generation of a CSV file that contains a list of errors, occured during import of product data file with id id_import_file. The generated file includes the following fields for each error:
  • ean: The EAN of the item
  • id_attribute: The ID of the attribute
  • status: Status of error
  • log_message: Log message
  • type_hook: Type of the hook
post.summary: Queue a product data import file errors report

post.description: Create a new push notification subscription for an event. Using this endpoint will result in a callback verification request being sent to the given callback_url. See the Push Notifications documentation page for more information on push notifications and callback verification.

parameters.description: Parameter to select the affected storefront
parameters.name: storefront

get.description: Get a push notification subscription by id_subscription.
get.summary: Get a push notification subscription by ID

patch.description: Update the fields of a push notification subscription. You can set the is_active flag to false to stop receiving notications for the subscription's event, or to true to re-enable a disabled subscription. If you change the value of the callback_url, the new callback_url will immediately receive a verification request. See the Callback URL Verification section of the Push Notifications documentation for details on validation requests.

delete.description: Deletes the specified push notification subscription from the database. To re-subscribe to the given event, you must use the add subscription endpoint.
